author: Chris Blakely

comments.comment: Suggested resource;  Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship by Robert C Martin.

description: Advice for JR devs on how to produce decent code.

quotes.quote: Clean code is focused — Each function, each class, and module should do one thing and do it well.
It should be elegant — Clean code should be simple to read. Reading it should make you smile. It should leave you thinking “I know exactly what this code is doing”
To make your code clear and easy to read, make sure the indentation, line breaks, and formatting are consistent.
...if you can’t name your function or method, then that function is doing too much.

title: The junior developer’s guide to writing super clean and readable code
